Which of the following can be used as an implantable carrier to enable slow drug release into the surrounding tissue locally?
Micro encapsulated tablets
Polymer coated tablets
Hydrogels and gelatin blocks

One of the well-known hydrogel slow releasing drug systems is gelatin. Gelatin is actually a processed version of collagen, which accounts for 1/3 of the protein in human body. Bonds called cross-links connect the collagen linear molecules to each other to create the gelatin mesh in return. In the following answers, which correctly describes the nature of the releasing system regarding the cross-links?
The stability and period of drug release is proportionally related to the cross-links of the gelatin carrier.
The stability and period of drug release is inversely related to the cross-links of the gelatin carrier.
The amount of cross-links in the gelatin mesh is not directly related to the stability and period of drug release from the gelatin carrier
